summary.para: The WINHTTP_PROXY_INFO structure contains the session or default proxy configuration.

remarks.para: This structure is used with and to get or set the proxy configuration for the current session by specifying the WINHTTP_OPTION_PROXY flag.
This structure is used with and to get or set the default proxy configuration in the registry.
The proxy server list contains one or more of the following strings separated by semicolons or whitespace.

The proxy bypass list contains one or more server names separated by semicolons or whitespace. The proxy bypass list can also contain the string "<local>" to indicate that all local intranet sites are bypassed. Local intranet sites are considered to be all servers that do not contain a period in their name.
Note For Windows XP and Windows 2000, see the Run-Time Requirements section of the WinHttp start page.

summary.para: Unsigned long integer value that contains the access type. This can be one of the following values:

description.para: Internet accessed through a direct connection.
Applies only when setting proxy information.

summary.para: Pointer to a string value that contains the proxy server list.
Pointer to a string value that contains the proxy bypass list.
